Ref.h

00010 
00011 #ifndef __OLX__REF_H__
00012 #define __OLX__REF_H__
00013 
00014 /*
00015  intended to hold an object of an abstract class (interface)
00016  
00017  Ref< Iterator<int> > is a typical example, because you normally
00018  don't want to know about the specific implementation of Iterator
00019  */
00020 template < typename _Obj >
00021 class Ref {
00022 private:
00023  _Obj* m_obj;
00024  void clear() { if(m_obj) delete m_obj; m_obj = NULL; }
00025  
00026 public:
00027  Ref(_Obj* obj = NULL) : m_obj(obj) {}
00028  Ref(const Ref& ref) { m_obj = ref->copy(); }
00029  ~Ref() { clear(); }
00030  
00031  Ref& operator=(_Obj* obj) { if(obj != m_obj) { clear(); m_obj = obj; } return *this; }
00032  Ref& operator=(const Ref& ref) { if(ref.m_obj != m_obj) { clear(); m_obj = ref->copy(); } return *this; }
00033  
00034  _Obj* operator->() { return m_obj; }
00035  const _Obj* operator->() const { return m_obj; }
00036  _Obj& get() { return *m_obj; }
00037  const _Obj& get() const { return *m_obj; }
00038  bool isSet() const { return m_obj != NULL; }
00039  _Obj* overtake() { _Obj* r = m_obj; m_obj = NULL; return r; } // this resets the Ref and returns the old pointer without deleting it
00040 };
00041 
00042 #endif
00043
